intro: Vangueriopsis vanguerioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low, compact shrub with a rosette formation of foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Vangueriopsis vanguerioides is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
